input:
Role & Objective
You are an expert AI Architect capable of understanding spatial layouts. 
Your task is to generate a residential floor plan in JSON format based on the user's semantic description and structural constraints.

Coordinate System Rules
1.Grid:All coordinates must be integers within the [0, 255] grid.
2.Axis:The coordinate system is image-based(Origin at Top-Left):Y-axis points Down, X-axis points Right.
3.Direction:North (Up):Y value decreases.South (Down):Y value increases.East (Right):X value increases.West (Left):X value decreases.
4.Bounds:Generated coordinates must strictly stay within the provided [0, 255] canvas and the specified Boundary Outline.

Topology & Geometry Rules
1.Anchor:The living room is the central anchor.In the overall layout,all other room positions (North, South, etc.) are relative to it.
2.Connectivity:No isolated rooms allowed. Every room must share at least one edge with another room.Rooms defined as adjacent in the input must share a boundary.Rooms without adjacent relationships do not share a boundary.
3.Polygon:The generated polygon must have no self intersection. All edges (walls) should be aligned with the axis (horizontal or vertical).
4.Alignment:Shared edges between adjacent rooms must align perfectly (no gaps).
5.Mutually Exclusive: The interiors of any two room polygons must be strictly disjoint. Boundaries can touch, but areas cannot overlap.
6.Tiling(NO GAPS):All rooms must fit strictly within the Boundary Outline Constraint Polygon.The Union of all room polygons must exactly equal the geometry of the Boundary Polygon.There must be no void spaces or unassigned areas inside the boundary.

Output Format
Return ONLY a JSON list, where each element represents a room:
[
  { "room": "living room", "boundary": [[x1, y1], [x2, y2], ...] },
  { "room": "kitchen", "boundary": [...] }
]

User Description
Design a floor plan with a total of 8 rooms, comprising: 1 bathroom, 3 common room, 1 master room, 1 kitchen, 1 living room, 1 balcony.The total area is 105.52 sqm.
The bathroom is located on the North-West side and requires approximately 6.05 sqm.
The common room 1 is located on the North-West side and requires approximately 6.29 sqm.
The common room 2 is located on the North-West side and requires approximately 15.1 sqm.
The master room is located on the West side and requires approximately 24.12 sqm.
The kitchen is located on the North side and requires approximately 4.84 sqm.
The common room 3 is located on the South-East side and requires approximately 7.75 sqm.
The living room is the central anchor and requires approximately 36.56 sqm.
The balcony is located on the South side and requires approximately 4.81 sqm.
Local Zone Layout (Fine-grained):Inside the North-West Zone,bathroom is located to the East of common room 2,common room 1 is located to the East of bathroom.

Constraints
1.Boundary Outline Constraint:
The entire layout must fit strictly within this polygon: [[184,57],[141,57],[115,57],[90,57],[46,57],[46,118],[63,118],[63,185],[127,185],[127,200],[184,200],[184,185],[211,185],[211,134],[184,134],[184,77],[184,57]]
You must partition the entire space.Total Room Area â‰ˆ 105.52 sqm.Every pixel inside the outline must be assigned to a room.No gaps are allowed between the polygons of the room.
2.Adjacency Constraint:
The following pairs MUST share a physical wall segment (Edge Length>0):(bathroom, common room 1), (bathroom, common room 2), (bathroom, living room), (common room 1, kitchen), (common room 1, living room), (common room 2, master room), (common room 2, living room), (master room, living room), (kitchen, living room), (common room 3, living room), (living room, balcony)
Point-only contact (Vertex Touching) is FORBIDDEN. They must share a line.
Any pair NOT listed above implies NO RELATIONSHIP.They must be physically separated (no shared edges).
3.Bounding Box Geometric Constraints:
Bounding Box Definition:A Bounding Box (BBox) is the minimal axis-aligned rectangle [min_x, min_y, max_x, max_y] that fully encloses a room's polygon.It represents the room's maximum spatial territory.
Containment Constraint:
Containment Relations (Container, Contained):None
If Listed (A, B):Room A's BBox MUST strictly enclose Room B's BBox. 
Logic: A.min_x <= B.min_x AND A.max_x >= B.max_x (Same for Y).Room B is essentially inside the span of Room A.
Intersection Constraint:
Intersection Relations (Box Overlap):(bathroom, living room), (common room 1, living room), (living room, master room)
If Listed (A, B):Their BBoxes MUST have a intersection area > 0.Intersection(Box(A), Box(B)).Area > 0.
Note: Bounding boxes MAY overlap, but the actual room polygon areas must be STRICTLY DISJOINT.
